fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringtarget genome
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringTarget genome file (FASTA)

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringID
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringID to distinguish the different reference species

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringReference annotation file (GFF or GTF), which contains gene models annotated in the reference genome

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringgenome
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringReference genome file (FASTA)

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringweight
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe weight can be used to prioritize predictions from different input files; each prediction will get an additional attribute sumWeight that can be used in the filter

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation info
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringannotation information of the reference, tab-delimted file containing at least the columns transcriptName, GO and .*defline

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringID
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringID to distinguish the different reference species

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcds parts
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe query cds parts file (FASTA), i.e., the cds parts that have been blasted

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringassignment
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe assignment file, which combines parts of the CDS to transcripts

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringweight
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe weight can be used to prioritize predictions from different input files; each prediction will get an additional attribute sumWeight that can be used in the filter

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation info
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringannotation information of the reference, tab-delimted file containing at least the columns transcriptName, GO and .*defline

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringID
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringID to distinguish the different reference species

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringReference annotation file (GFF or GTF), which contains gene models annotated in the reference genome

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringgenome
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringReference genome file (FASTA)

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringweight
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe weight can be used to prioritize predictions from different input files; each prediction will get an additional attribute sumWeight that can be used in the filter

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation info
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringannotation information of the reference, tab-delimted file containing at least the columns transcriptName, GO and .*defline

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringID
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringID to distinguish the different reference species

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcds parts
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe query cds parts file (FASTA), i.e., the cds parts that have been blasted

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringassignment
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe assignment file, which combines parts of the CDS to transcripts

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringweight
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe weight can be used to prioritize predictions from different input files; each prediction will get an additional attribute sumWeight that can be used in the filter

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation info
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringannotation information of the reference, tab-delimted file containing at least the columns transcriptName, GO and .*defline

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringID
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringID to distinguish the different external annotations of the target organism

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringexternal annotation
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringExternal annotation file (GFF,GTF) of the target organism, which contains gene models from an external source (e.g., ab initio gene prediction) and will be integrated in the module GAF

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringweight
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe weight can be used to prioritize predictions from different input files in the module GAF; each prediction will get an additional attribute sumWeight that can be used in the filter

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringannotation evidence
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringrun AnnotationEvidence on this external annotation

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringselected
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe path to list file, which allows to make only a predictions for the contained transcript ids. The first column should contain transcript IDs as given in the annotation. Remaining columns can be used to determine a target region that should be overlapped by the prediction, if columns 2 to 5 contain chromosome, strand, start and end of region

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringgenetic code
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringoptional user-specified genetic code

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringtblastn
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif *true* tblastn is used as search algorithm, otherwise mmseqs is used. Tblastn and mmseqs need to be installed to use the corresponding option

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringtag
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA user-specified tag for transcript predictions in the third column of the returned gff. It might be beneficial to set this to a specific value for some genome browsers.

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.StringStranded
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.StringDefines whether the reads are stranded. In case of FR_FIRST_STRAND, the first read of a read pair or the only read in case of single-end data is assumed to be located on forward strand of the cDNA, i.e., reverse to the mRNA orientation. If you are using Illumina TruSeq you should use FR_FIRST_STRAND.

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringFR_UNSTRANDED
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringFR_FIRST_STRAND
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringFR_SECOND_STRAND
simpleParameter.comment: null

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringmapped reads file
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringBAM/SAM files containing the mapped reads

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringmapped reads file
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringBAM/SAM files containing the mapped reads

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.StringValidationStringency
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.StringDefines how strict to be when reading a SAM or BAM, beyond bare minimum validation.

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringSTRICT
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringLENIENT
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringSILENT
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringuse secondary alignments
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to filter flags in the SAM or BAM

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcoverage
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to output the coverage

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringminimum mapping quality
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringreads with a mapping quality that is lower than this value will be ignored

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringminimum context
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringonly introns that have evidence of at least one split read with a minimal M (=(mis)match) stretch in the cigar string larger than or equal to this value will be used

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringintrons
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIntrons (GFF), which might be obtained from RNA-seq

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringintrons
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIntrons (GFF), which might be obtained from RNA-seq

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcoverage_unstranded
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe coverage file contains the unstranded coverage of the genome per interval. Intervals with coverage 0 (zero) can be left out.

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcoverage_forward
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe coverage file contains the forward coverage of the genome per interval. Intervals with coverage 0 (zero) can be left out.

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcoverage_reverse
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe coverage file contains the reverse coverage of the genome per interval. Intervals with coverage 0 (zero) can be left out.

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdenoise
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringremoving questionable introns that have been extracted by ERE

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringmaximum intron length
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe maximum length of an intron

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringminimum expression
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe threshold for removing introns

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcontext
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe context upstream a donor and donwstream an acceptor site that is used to determine the expression of the region

parameterSetContainer.name: java.lang.StringExtractor parameter set
parameterSetContainer.comment: java.lang.Stringparameters for the Extrator module of GeMoMa

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringupcase IDs
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringwhether the IDs in the GFF should be upcased

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringrepair
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif a transcript annotation can not be parsed, the program will try to infer the phase of the CDS parts to repair the annotation

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.StringAmbiguity
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThis parameter defines how to deal with ambiguities in the DNA. There are 3 options: EXCEPTION, which will remove the corresponding transcript, AMBIGUOUS, which will use an X for the corresponding amino acid, and RANDOM, which will randomly select an amnio acid from the list of possibilities.

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringEXCEPTION
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringAMBIGUOUS
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringRANDOM
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdiscard pre-mature stop
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif *true* transcripts with pre-mature stop codon are discarded as they often indicate misannotation

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringstop-codon excluded from CDS
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA flag that states whether the reference annotation contains the stop codon in the CDS annotation or not

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringfull-length
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA flag which allows for choosing between only full-length and all (i.e., full-length and partial) transcripts

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringreads
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif introns are given by a GFF, only use those which have at least this number of supporting split reads

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringsplice
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif no intron is given by RNA-seq, compute candidate splice sites or not

fileParameter.name: java.lang.Stringsubstitution matrix
fileParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringoptional user-specified substitution matrix

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringgap opening
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe gap opening cost in the alignment

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringgap extension
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe gap extension cost in the alignment

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringmaximum intron length
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe maximum length of an intron

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringstatic intron length
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA flag which allows to switch between static intron length, which can be specified by the user and is identical for all genes, and dynamic intron length, which is based on the gene-specific maximum intron length in the reference organism plus the user given maximum intron length

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringintron-loss-gain-penalty
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe penalty used for intron loss and gain

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringe-value
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe e-value for filtering blast results

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcontig threshold
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe threshold for evaluating contigs

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringregion threshold
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe threshold for evaluating regions

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringhit threshold
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe threshold for adding additional hits

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringpredictions
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe (maximal) number of predictions per transcript

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringavoid stop
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA flag which allows to avoid (additional) pre-mature stop codons in a transcript

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringapprox
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringwhether an approximation is used to compute the score for intron gain

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringprotein alignment
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringwhether a protein alignment between the prediction and the reference transcript should be computed. If so two additional attributes (iAA, pAA) will be added to predictions in the gff output. These might be used in GAF. However, since some transcripts are very long this can increase the needed runtime and memory (RAM).

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringprefix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA prefix to be used for naming the predictions

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringtimeout
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringThe (maximal) number of seconds to be used for the predictions of one transcript, if exceeded GeMoMa does not output a prediction for this transcript.

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.StringScore
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA flag which allows to do nothing, re-score or re-align the search results

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringTrust
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringReScore
simpleParameter.comment: null

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringReAlign
simpleParameter.comment: null

parameterSetContainer.name: java.lang.StringGAF parameter set
parameterSetContainer.comment: java.lang.Stringparameters for the GAF module of GeMoMa

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringcommon border filter
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe filter on the common borders of transcripts, the lower the more transcripts will be checked as alternative splice isoforms

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringmaximal number of transcripts per gene
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe maximal number of allowed transcript predictions per gene

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdefault attributes
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringComma-separated list of attributes that is set to NaN if they are not given in the annotation file. This allows to use these attributes for sorting or filter criteria. It is especially meaningful if the gene annotation files were received fom different software packages (e.g., GeMoMa, Braker, ...) having different attributes.

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringfilter
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringA filter can be applied to transcript predictions to receive only reasonable predictions. The filter is applied to the GFF attributes. The default filter decides based on the completeness of the prediction (start=='M' and stop=='*') and the relative score (score/aa>=0.75) whether a prediction is used or not. In addition, predictions without score (isNaN(score)) will be used as external annotations do not have the attribute score. Different criteria can be combined using 'and' and 'or'. A more sophisticated filter could be applied for instance using the completeness, the relative score, the evidence as well as statistics based on RNA-seq: start=='M' and stop=='*' and score/aa>=0.75 and (evidence>1 or tpc==1.0)
simpleParameter.defaultValue: java.lang.Stringstart=='M' and stop=='*' and (isNaN(score) or score/aa>=0.75)
simpleParameter.value: java.lang.Stringstart=='M' and stop=='*' and (isNaN(score) or score/aa>=0.75)

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringsorting
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringcomma-separated list that defines the way predictions are sorted within a cluster

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringalternative transcript filter
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf a prediction is suggested as an alternative transcript, this additional filter will be applied. The filter works syntactically like the 'filter' parameter and allows you to keep the number of alternative transcripts small based on meaningful criteria. Reasonable filter could be based on RNA-seq data (tie==1) or on evidence (evidence>1). A more sophisticated filter could be applied combining several criteria: tie==1 or evidence>1

parameterSetContainer.name: java.lang.StringAnnotationFinalizer parameter set
parameterSetContainer.comment: java.lang.Stringparameters for the AnnotationFinalizer module of GeMoMa

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.StringUTR
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to predict UTRs using RNA-seq data

collectionParameter.name: java.lang.Stringrename
collectionParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to generate generic gene and transcripts names (cf. parameter "name attribute")

parameterSetContainer.name: java.lang.StringCOMPOSED
parameterSetContainer.comment: java.lang.Stringcomposed renaming: <prefix><contig/chr*><infix><number><suffix>; recommended for whole genome (re-)annotations

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringprefix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe prefix of the generic name

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringinfix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe infix of the generic name

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringsuffix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe suffix of the generic name

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdigits
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe number of informative digits

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdelete infix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringa comma-separated list of infixes that is deleted from the sequence names before building the gene/transcript name

parameterSetContainer.name: java.lang.StringSIMPLE
parameterSetContainer.comment: java.lang.Stringsimple renaming: <prefix><number>; recommended for gene family annotations

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringprefix
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe prefix of the generic name

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdigits
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringthe number of informative digits

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringname attribute
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringif true the new name is added as new attribute "Name", otherwise "Parent" and "ID" values are modified accordingly

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringpredicted proteins
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf *true*, returns the predicted proteins of the target organism as fastA file

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringpredicted CDSs
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf *true*, returns the predicted CDSs of the target organism as fastA file

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringpredicted genomic regions
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf *true*, returns the genomic regions of predicted gene models of the target organism as fastA file

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringoutput individual predictions
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf *true*, returns the predictions for each reference species

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringdebug
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.StringIf *false* removes all temporary files even if the jobs exits unexpected

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.Stringrestart
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringcan be used to restart the latest GeMoMaPipeline run, which was finished without results, with very similar parameters, e.g., after an exception was thrown (cf. parameter debug)

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringBLAST_PATH
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to set a path to the blast binaries if not set in the environment

simpleParameter.name: java.lang.StringMMSEQS_PATH
simpleParameter.comment: java.lang.Stringallows to set a path to the blast binaries if not set in the environment
